September 7, 2011, Debby worked with Julie but at different companies

I have had the privilege of being cast by Julie countless times over the past 15 years. My agent adores her and so do I! It is always a pleasure going to a casting by Julie and working with her on set. She really cares that each actor has the best audition possible. She gives the actor every opportunity to be their very best in an audition through respect, guidance and sincere and genuine love of the business. I have witnessed Julie's work ethic- of going above and beyond what is expected, not only in the audition but also on the set. Her passion and talent as a casting director are undeniably exceptional.
Julie Cook

summary: She is represented by The Leighton Agency in Phoenix and by Baron Entertainment in LA. She has appeared in over 100 on-camera TV commercials, over 60 industrial films and has done 100's of voice-overs for industrial films, radio, and TV. Most recently she had a supporting role in the feature film “Ingenious”, starring 2-time Oscar Nominee, Jeremy Renner. She has appeared on Unsolved Mysteries, HBO movie “El Diablo”, hosted five 30-minute infomercials and was a regular on ABC 15’s Sonoran Living as their "Theater Guru" and hosted the morning talk show when Traci Kornet took time off. She can currently be seen on TV in: Don't Trash Arizona, Arizona Lottery, Goodwill and EBooks commercials. On the radio, she is currently "the" voice for Desert Schools Federal Credit Union & Meritage Homes. Due out in 2013, she can be seen in the feature film in a leading role in "Intersect", starring James Morrison, from the TV show "24".Debby graduated from ASU with a Bachelor of Music degree and became a member of Actors Equity Association in 1988. She has performed in over 70 regional professional music theater productions. Debby also teaches private on-camera acting, singing lessons & career guidance. Most recently, she taught a 3 day masterclass at CGCC & was the key-note speaker for the NATS music theater competition. She has helped countless actors empower their performance & careers. She and her husband, Tom Wojtas, have two children, Tommy and Abby.
name: Debby Rosenthal
title: Actress for Film,TV & VO with Leighton Agency, Stage & Singer w/ Actors Equity Association     www.debbyrosenthal.com
